author: FranklinYu
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

As a user I want to `Start-Process` with new environment variables.

# Proposed technical implementation details

Currently we do

```powershell
Start-Process PowerShell -ArgumentList '-Command',"`$env:FOO='bar'; main.exe"
```

But this is cumbersome. It would be great if we can specify some environment as argument to `Start-Process`, like

```powershell
Start-Process main.exe -Environment @{ FOO = 'bar' }
```

This feature request is related to #4671. See also [this question on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1420719/powershell-setting-an-environment-variable-for-a-single-command-only).
